properties.title: The mod_jk Module for the Apache Web Server
properties.author: Jean-Frederic Clere

section.name: What is the mod_jk Module
section.p: mod_jk2 is originated back to the old mod_jserv. mod_jk2 is a rewrite of mod_jk. The native part has been completly restructured and the configuration has been simplified a lot.

section.name: Why should I use the mod_jk2 Module?
section.p: Because it offers a lot of different and flexible communications between a Web Server and the Tomcat Servlet Engine.

section.name: Are there alternative ways to connect Apache and Tomcat?
section.p: The alternative ways are better described in mod_webapp documentation. Check there for it and then decide if you want to go on reading. The big advantage of mod_webapp is that is very easy to configure, has a well defined protocol named WARP, does not care about the old crappy protocols used in Tomcat-3.x and so. But it would be possible to implement the WARP protocol in mod_jk2 ;-))
